meanings.definition: A sudden burst or splash of liquid.
meanings.sent1: The sposh of water from the fountain was refreshing.
meanings.sent2: I felt the sposh of rain on my face as I stepped outside.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy caused a sposh when it jumped into the puddle.
meanings.sent4: The sposh of colors in the painting caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The sposh of lemonade on the hot day was a delightful surprise.

meanings.definition: To splash or spatter with liquid.
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to sposh water on the floor while washing dishes.
meanings.sent2: The kids love to sposh each other with water balloons in the summer.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally sposhed her friend while playing with the hose.
meanings.sent4: The storm sposhed the windows with raindrops, creating a blurry view.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully sposhed the sauce onto the dish for a beautiful presentation.

meanings.definition: A lavish or extravagant display or expenditure.
meanings.sent1: The sposh of decorations at the party was stunning.
meanings.sent2: She admired the sposh of jewels on display at the store.
meanings.sent3: The sposh of fireworks lit up the night sky in celebration.
meanings.sent4: The sposh of gifts under the tree made the children excited.
meanings.sent5: The sposh of flavors in the meal made it a memorable dining experience.
